numeric_premises.content: The latest convective inhibition (LatestCIN) is nonexistent 40% of the time, provides partial inhibition another 40%, stifles convection in 15% of cases, and completely inhibits in 5% of the occurrences.
The likelihood of an unfavorable LLIW severe weather index is 12%, weak is 32%, moderate is 38%, and strong is 18%.

In unfavorable LLIW conditions when latest convective inhibition is nonexistent, there is a 70% probability that the current propensity to convection is none, 28% that it is slight, and only a 2% and 0% chance that it is moderate or strong, respectively.

When latest convective inhibition is absent and LLIW is weak, the current propensity to convection is slightly high (50%) or moderately high (30%). In addition, there is a 10% probability that convection is strong, and only a 10% chance that it is nonexistent.

With no latest convective inhibition and LLIW at moderate levels, the current propensity to convection is more likely to be moderate (35%) or strong (50%). There is only a 14% probability that convection is slight, and a mere 1% chance that it is nonexistent.

When latest convective inhibition is absent and LLIW is strong, the current propensity to convection is strong most of the times (80%). There is only an 18% probability that convection is moderate, a mere 2% chance that it is slight, and 0% chance of being nonexistent.

If latest convective inhibition is partially inhibited and LLIW is unfavorable, there is a 90% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 9% chance that it is slight, and only a 1% probability that it is moderate, whereas being strong is impossible.

When latest convective inhibition is partially inhibited and LLIW is weak, there is a 65% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 25% chance that it is slight, and only a 9% and 1% probability that it is moderate or strong, respectively.

If latest convective inhibition is partially inhibited and LLIW is moderate, there is a 25% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 35% chance that it is slight, a 30% probability that it is moderate, and a 10% probability that it is strong.

When latest convective inhibition is partially inhibited and LLIW is strong, there is a 1% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 15% chance that it is slight, a 33% probability that it is moderate, and a 51% probability that it is strong.

If latest convective inhibition is stifling and LLIW is unfavorable, there is a 95% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 5% chance that it is slight, and no probability that it is moderate or strong.

When latest convective inhibition is stifling and LLIW is weak, there is a 75% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 23% chance that it is slight, a 2% probability that it is moderate, and no probability that it is strong.

If latest convective inhibition is stifling and LLIW is moderate, there is a 40% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent or slight, followed by an 18% probability that it is moderate, and a 2% probability that it is strong.

When latest convective inhibition is stifling and LLIW is strong, there is a 20% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 30% chance that it is slight, a 35% probability that it is moderate, and a 15% probability that it is strong.

If latest convective inhibition is totally inhibited and LLIW is unfavorable, there is a 100% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, and no probability that it is slight, moderate, or strong.

When latest convective inhibition is totally inhibited and LLIW is weak, there is a 95% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 5% chance that it is slight, and no probability that it is moderate or strong.

If latest convective inhibition is totally inhibited and LLIW is moderate, there is a 75% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 20% chance that it is slight, and a 5% probability that it is moderate, and no probability that it is strong.

When latest convective inhibition is totally inhibited and LLIW is strong, there is a 50% probability that the current propensity to convection is nonexistent, followed by a 35% chance that it is slight, a 10% probability that it is moderate, and a 5% probability that it is strong.
